author: Silly Sausage
comment: This is the maddest thing I've ever seen. Electricity price roulette!. Totally unfathomable. Also, why does it forget your payment method?

author: Lynda Bradley
comment: Great if you're on a budget.

author: Paul Johnston
comment: Very well written app

author: Cassandra Coleman
comment: I have been a customer for the last 10 month and I use the apparently frequently the only problem I have is one the month has ended the is no potion to pay in instalments. I am in a flatting environment and its hard to put money on in advance. Could you please add an option to pay part of the owing bill instead of adding in onto the next months.
No longer shows per 30 minute usage.

reply.author: Powershop
reply.content: The app should still show your 30min usage on the Daily Usage screen if you still have a smart meter. If it's not there can you get in contact through the app Contact Us screen or on www.powershop.co.nz/contact-us/ so we can get this fixed!

author: Reagan Reece-Hay
comment: Best power company and easy to keep track

author: Gwenda Waldron
comment: Love the power savings

author: NA
comment: Worst Power company to deal with. You are far better off joining ELECTRIC KIWI.  They are no1 in NZ....where PowerShop is now 3rd. Do not join PowerShop, you have been warned.

author: Hiren Patel
comment: This app is not accepting the password also.

reply.author: Powershop
reply.content: Hi Hiren. You can reset your password from the login screen in the Powershop App. Or give us a call on 0800 462 668 and we can reset it for you.

author: James Kitney
comment: Really hate this app since its been changed to dollars per day. I really have no idea how much power I am actually buying anymore so the whole point of using powershop has gone. Definitely switching to flick as some as my $150 credit has been used up.

author: geraldine bock
comment: I have been with powershop for 12 years and now im looking for another company. I really dislike the new $per day where it used to be units perday it doesnt tell you how much your actually using or buying anymore.

author: J Davies
comment: @powershop why are you not listening to your customer feedback? the change from units to per day is frustrating. If you want to introduce per day - why not show both??!!

author: Vincent & Einnoc
comment: I strongly agreed with other comments, new system is very confusing, you can't hide units usage form customer

author: William Comnisky
comment: It's very user friendly. Could have some other features as the website (charts)..

author: osiriswolfe
comment: I agree with other comments here about the change to less transparent pricing. In fact I haven't brought a power up since the change. Looking to move to another provider because of it. Frankly I hate this type of obfuscation. You have until my Pre paid purchases run out to add the option for absolute pricing again or you've lost me to another vendor.
title: Nothing wrong with the app, but...

author: Daniel Sun
comment: I was waiting too long to get the old system back. It's not only that they change the system. Even the deals are much less then the first year.... It's time to find another provider. Thanks, for the first year.
title: Enough.

author: Simon James
comment: Great app

author: alocalperson
comment: Much prefer to see how many units I'm using - I think it's less transparent and way too confusing. Please change it back!
title: Don't like the new system!

author: Ishwa Dadi
comment: It's like buying petrol in km?
title: New version is pathetic

author: RAJU R
comment: Good
title: Good

author: Fábio Pacheco Paiva
comment: The "new app system" actually changed the way packs work. There used to be a direct and objective discount relation between packs. The units system never lied. But now, since they are hiding information behind the "average day" thingy, I can only conclude that all packs cost the same. The only difference now is the amount you are buying, so no discounts AT ALL. Smart move guys, smart move. So amazing I am not even mad... Actually, I am. And I'm leaving you.

author: Russell O'Bery
comment: Bring back the old system. I don't want to know how long my available power will last. I want to know how much power I'm using. Only then can I compare if your power per kWh is competitive.
title: Giving Powershop the Flick!

author: Stewart Powell
comment: Love the app, but why did you remove unit rates on Power Packs? Please put them back. Other than that this is a great tool.
title: Bring back unit prices...

author: Peter Harrison
comment: They have totally confused their charging. Avoid Powershop.
title: Totally stuffed

author: Nonnie Davies
comment: Go  back  to ur  old  way  ( please )
title: Off track  power  shop

author: Mark S
comment: Very disappointed in change and removal of unit prices
title: Really hate that no unit prices

author: Mat
comment: Put cost per kWh back!
title: Kwh

author: David Lau
comment: mine stopped working about a week ago after the unit change
title: the app now crashes on multiple devices uninstall install same thing. are you listening or should i swap suppliers?

author: Chris Barnett
comment: Put the unit prices back on the specials and unit usage data back the way it used to be! Very deceiving way to sell power using approximately $per day rather than the actual unit price. We will be switching companies if this isn't resolved
title: Used to be awesome

author: Shiree Schofield
comment: Used to be awesome but since the unit rate has been removed from specials and what I've used I feel like you're trying to rip me off. The new special setup doesn't seem like much of a special.
title: Put the unit price back

author: Pete Lim
comment: The updated app is confusing. They have deleted the kWh units making it harder to compare. I'm considering to change power companies.

author: Paul Chin
comment: Household appliances include wattage on the label. Imagine if your dryer was labelled with "uses 0.1 days of electricity per hour". That may be where we're heading, but the powershop app now appears out of step with the rest of the electricity ecosystem.
title: Please bring back unit costs

author: Dennis Rich
comment: I think this is a terrible mistake.  I'm leaving so fast they hardly see me go if they don't fix it.  It says I have no money in the account and I have heaps.  I be blowing down the phone come Monday.

author: steve g
comment: Was better before you took away the amount of units in each pack, I don't know what I'm buying because the estimations are well wrong
title: Was better

comment: Unit prices are great way to show my purchases and usage. Please bring it back.
title: Please bring back unit price

author: Simon Burrough
comment: The new app is confusing. You can't see how many kwh's you're buying for each pack. Combining multiple properties into one is dumb, especially if some are tax deductible.
title: The old app was great...

author: Chirag Patel
comment: This app will tempt you buy power by coming up with special rate offers. If you do ur calculation right then at the end of month you will figure out that they just are ripping of customers as they end up paying more than their current service provider. I will switch back to Energy Online as they are not cheaters like Powershop. I thought we will save some money by switching to powershop but for the last 4 months i have ended up paying way more than my previous energy provider.
title: Rip Off

author: Rewa Sheryl Apiti
comment: Been with powershop for a while tried using another company found it expensive so shot back fast to power shop never will I leave again.  They been fantastic to deal with.

author: Chris Green
comment: Great app and great power company. Would recommend to anyone I know that it's sick of getting power bills each month
title: Great app

comment: Now I have the opportunity to be proper ocd with every light switch in the house....
title: Cool
